WaveSoundBuffer.globalFocusMode

Function/Meaning
Focus Mode
Type
Property of WaveSoundBuffer class (read/write)
Description
Represents the focus mode. You can also set the value.
Focus mode is a mode that mutes the sound when the application is minimized or becomes inactive.
If sgfmNeverMute is specified, it will not mute regardless of the application state.
If sgfmMuteOnMinimize is specified, it mutes when the application is minimized.
If sgfmMuteOnDeactivate is specified, it mutes when the application is deactivated.
This property exists only on the WaveSoundBuffer class (this property does not exist on objects created from WaveSoundBuffer). Use it as WaveSoundBuffer.globalFocusMode.
The setting of '-wsmute' (DirectSound mute) specified in the command line options takes precedence over the setting of this property.
